nz.ac.vuw.ecs.swen225.a3.render

Interface ChapsView

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ChapsViewImpl, LevelBuilderDisplay

    public interface ChapsView
    An interface that represents the view for Chap's Challenge. Receives updates from the application package and uses those updates to render the board as well as display important information such as the time, level, inventory, etc.
     

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearDisplayTutorialMessage()
      Clears any tutorial message, if any is present
      javax.swing.JSplitPane getRootPanel()
      Return's a reference to the JPanel that contains all the necessary views for the game.

      Sets a tutorial message to be displayed, occluding the inventory area.

      Updates the display with the current level

      Updates the display with what's currently in the inventory

    • Method Detail

      • updateBoard

        void updateBoard(Visible[][] board)
        Given the visible section of the board, updates the GUI.
        Parameters:
        board - A 2D array of renderables representing the visible area of the board. The width and height of the array must be exactly Constants.VISIBLE_SIZE

      • updateRemainingChips

        void updateRemainingChips(int rem)
        Updates the display with the number of chips remaining
        Parameters:
        rem - The number of remaining chips

      • updateRemainingTime

        void updateRemainingTime(int rem)
        Updates the display with the number of chips remaining
        Parameters:
        rem - The number of remaining time

        void updateCurrentLevel(int lvl)
        Updates the display with the current level
        Parameters:
        lvl - the current level number

      • updateInventory

        void updateInventory(java.util.Collection<Visible> v)

        Parameters:
        v - list of icons

      • clearDisplayTutorialMessage

      • getRootPanel

        javax.swing.JSplitPane getRootPanel()
        Return's a reference to the JPanel that contains all the necessary views for the game. This JPanel isn't new but rather a reference to the one updated by this view.
        Returns:
        This view's root JPanel
